issues.description: The problem statement and template repository specify classes named Seal, Pig, and Goat (per the UML diagram and tasks), but the solution repository defines these classes as SpaceSeal, SpacePig, and SpaceGoat. This discrepancy in type names will confuse students about which class names to implement and prevents direct correspondence between the UML/spec and the provided solution.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the solution repository classes from SpaceSeal, SpacePig, and SpaceGoat to Seal, Pig, and Goat (and update any constructor calls and references) so that the class names align with the UML diagram and the problem description.

issues.description: The Solution Repository uses class names SpaceSeal, SpacePig, and SpaceGoat while the Problem Statement and Template Repository expect Seal, Pig, and Goat. This mismatch prevents students from mapping their implementations (Seal, Pig, Goat) to the provided solution classes.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the solution classes to Seal, Pig, and Goat (remove the “Space” prefix) so they match the class names specified in the Problem Statement and Template Repository.
